p: Among potential anti-COVID-19 drugs we report the phytochemical geniposide; this TMPRSS2 inhibitor should be validated for treatment of coronavirus infection as it does not show toxicity in humans, since it has been reported that geniposide cannot cross the bloodâ€“brain barrier and it is not absorbed by the gastrointestinal tract [90]. In addition, geniposide protects against sepsis-induced myocardial dysfunction by activating AMPK which suppresses myocardial reactive oxygen species (ROS) accumulation [104].
